Sorry we couldn't spill the beans sooner! This was one of the hardest to keep quiet about, haha. 

This is one example of if a champion fits for a specific skin thematic that's tied to a particular time of year, we'll hold the skin until the right time. Welp, it's nearly summer - let the pool party begin! :D 

Hope you like him!

is it Halloween? WHEN WHEN WHEN
Yorick won't get a skin until his rework is finished. You know it's sad but truuuuuueeee.

> [{quoted}](name=Kindlejack,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=KEr0jqO9,comment-id=000500010000,timestamp=2015-06-10T07:18:22.449+0000)

> Yorick won't get a skin until his rework is finished. You know it's sad but truuuuuueeee.

The same rework that got cancelled/put on hold indefinitely?
No not that one. He is actually moving forward with the champup team again!
HYPE

I have a curious question. Will skins like Pool Party Ahri ever get a chance to come out or is Riot worried that releasing such a swimsuit skin on a human form would cause some uproars. I'm really curious about that what with all the drama about making female champions less sexy in terms of their assets and more...I guess manly (The new Blizzard shooter with the pink man/woman comes to mind XD).

Don't forget Johanna the Crusader in HotS!

I think it's fine to do sexy when it makes sense. It's not something we shy away from either, but there has to be more to a skin than just 'Ahri in a Bikini'.

>there has to be more to a skin than just 'Ahri in a Bikini'.

But it's fine when it's just Graves and Draven in a swimsuit?

I'm confused.
Graves just makes a lot of sense with the super soaker though.

Syndra just makes a lot of sense with beach balls though.

Irelia just makes a lot of sense with a surf board though. 

Tons of pool party skins for female champs makes a lot of sense, but we can't have them because it's "just x champ in a bikini." I'm just confused why they essentially keep making male pool party skins that are just x champ in a swim suit but say they can't do the same for female champions.
They don't want to be sexist, but this response/special treatment is already being sexist.

>but there has to be more to a skin than just 'Ahri in a Bikini'.

Uh...no there doesn't?  This is literally what we've been asking for since pool party skins were announced.
Pool Party Irelia pls. :)
I doubt they will make a pool party Irelia because they just made a skin for her
And because they'd just say it's a female in a bikini excuse :(
I don't care. I still want her.
A lot of us do man. Along with the release of Pool Party skins for all the other human female champs :(
As a warm blooded heterosexual male I disagree with you to the fullest extent possible that we can't just have a "ahri in a bikini skin".

I'm going to call bullshit on you right here.

"It's fine to do sexy when it makes sense"

When does sexy make more sense than on Ahri? A big part of Ahri's whole shtick as a character is sexual appeal. Luring men with her charm to steal their "essense".

Don't get me wrong. I get somewhat where you're coming from. Having a bit more personality to the skin is nice (And I've seen a lot of really good idea from this thread alone). But to Say that sexy for the sake of sexy doesn't make sense on Ahri is bullshit.

Make the skin simple, charge 750 rp for it. Done. I'm happy. Will shop again.

Put more effort into the theme, charge more. Done. I'm still happy (Not nessecarily more or less happy). Will shop again.

I honestly just want Ahri in a swimsuit. Doesn't even have to be bikini. I don't believe her outfit was a bikini in splashes she was in. Give me that suit. It looked great. I'm a hopeless pervert.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=KEr0jqO9,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-06-09T23:20:13.384+0000)
>
> Sorry we couldn't spill the beans sooner! This was one of the hardest to keep quiet about, haha. 
> 
> This is one example of if a champion fits for a specific skin thematic that's tied to a particular time of year, we'll hold the skin until the right time. Welp, it's nearly summer - let the pool party begin! :D 
> 
> Hope you like him!

Katey, please, please tell me: Is Pool Party {{champion:103}} in the pipeline. THINK OF THE FINANCIAL POTENTIAL

When it comes to Pool Party you can see that no champion is off the table! However with a lot of the LoL female champs there is not much visual interest in their silhouette/body type (personally I see this as a big mistake made in the past) so putting them in a swimsuit almost creates the 'anime effect' where they can only be distinguished by their hair colour. That's a bit of an exaggeration but what I'm getting at is that a straight up 'this champion minus the outfit' is underwhelming and often very odd looking due to removing bulky armour etc. If we do a champion like Ahri there needs to be a theme to the outfit and not just
-clothes
+bikini.
Graves has a water gun... That's kind of the point

Syndra can have beach balls, Irelia can have a surfboard. Hell, even Lissandra could have sand castles surrounding her instead of constant ice! The potential is there, Riot is just scared of the feminists.
Yes, I'm sure that's the case. The company that brought you Miss Fortune and Sona are scared of feminists. Sounds more like you're the scared one. "Feminists! Everywhere! Thwarting men's every move!"

MF and Sona are champs created years before any of this sexualization of men and women exploded to what it is today. Kindlejack even admits a few posts above how champions with the only visual appear to them being their forms was a mistake -although in his own eyes. I doubt the Riot today would release hypersexualized champions like Sona, MF or even Ahri and it's showing with champs like Jinx and Kalista. And you know, cool, diversity. But when you have a Rioter say that putting a champion like Ahri in a swimsuit is just an excuse to have her in a swimsuit with no creative theme to back it up and yet they create Pool Party Draven and put him in a speedo...where's the equality in that?

And lastly, if I was scared as you implied shouldn't I be fighting to take down something like Pool Party Draven? I haven't made any mention against Draven's new skin. Heck, it's cool. Though, no different than what you can do with 'a female/human formed champ in a swimsuit'...right?

Why not ahri as a synchronized swimmer, that would be a pretty fun skin and its related to pools, ahri could be a surfer girl as well. Pool party skins for a lot of female champs can be more than just a bikini you know. :/

For me the appeal of the pool party skins is that the champions are exploring a theme that's very familiar to me and relate-able and its fun to imagine how a certain champion would engage with that kind of environment. Its hard to relate to sand guardians and connect with a champion, but pool party I can definitely do that. So if certain female champions aren't going to get a pool party skin because you can't think of something a bit more creative than a bikini than that's kind of disappointing. :/

Also nothing wrong with bikinis or swimsuits for the record.

I'm trying to find the right place to put this reply. Hopefully this will do/

I apologise for not being clearer. I began by saying that yes, there is still a chance of seeing more shapely ladies in the pool party line in the future. However I wanted to point out that this year there were much stronger visual and thematic hooks for other champions that the team were more excited about. I was, in fact, the person that raised the concern that we didn't have a human female in this year's line up as the first year's splash art teased quite a few. But without a strong thematic to pitch 'Ahri with a Beach Ball' lost out to the other thematics. We are definitely aware that people really want more pool party girls and I hope we can deliver more in the future!

Replying to this so that you'll at least know my reason for downvoting.Yes,we want more female champions in the pool party skin line.But when we keep getting blatantly teased with the possibility for things like Pool Party Ahri and Orianna in the other champions splash art with clear outfit concepts for them already made and then you come along and it appears you're saying "Oh yeah,those aren't happening." it becomes VERY frustrating when we've been waiting so long to see those in game.

 Especially when you do all of these skins injustice by saying "It would just be Ahri in a bikini if we did that."Like many others here have argued Draven and Graves can both be whittled down to the same argument you were trying to make against Ahri.Those pool  toy gun and axes are equivalent to a beach ball,and their swim trunks and speedo are equivalent to a swimsuit.For the record though,If I remember right Ahri's pool party concept was a Monokini,not a bikini.It's a mix between a one-piece and a bikini.

 I would like to stress though it doesn't make Graves or Draven's pool party skins less nice,and it should not be a reason to scrap the concepts we saw for several of the female champions in the pool party splashes.This all left such a bitter taste in my mouth I lost all drive to even want to buy pool party Zac,and that was a skin I was looking forward to from those same splashes.
 
So just please keep all this in mind when doing the next set of pool party skins,there are still many skins from those splashes we've now been waiting years for.

Dude,there are 125 champs in the game & 115 without pool party skins.It's going to take time for these champs to get pool party skin.

Ahri or Orianna shouldn't be 1st in line because they were teased in previous pool party splashes.There were other champs teased as well.There are also champs who weren't in the pool party splashes.

I get that you're frustrated that champ X didn't get a pool party skin even though the idea was teased before.Yes,it sucks champ X didn't get a pool party skin even though it could have been a cool skin.Now Champ X players have to wait at least a year or more to see if Champ X is getting a pool party skin.
But that doesn't make champ X a higher priority over champ Y as far as who get a pool party skin.All champs,teased before or not,are & should be on equal footing.

Please note that I'm not disagreeing with your whole post nor am I agreeing with Kindlejack's statement.I just felt like addressing the feel of entitlement (well,it feels that way to me) in the 1st paragraph.

Sorry,I'll try to clear that up a little.It's not really me being entitled.I actually wasn't expecting Ahri or Ori to get a pool party skin this year because Ori had just gotten one during snowdown,and Ahri had gotten one at the very start of the season.I was fine with that.
 
What I am not fine with is a Rioter saying(Granted they...kind of...retracted what they said) that those skins in particular aren't going to be made for reasons that were very contradictory.But yes I agree,all champs should have an equal footing in this.

I still don't understand how Draven in a swimsuit is a strong theme, or one at all. His weapons don't even lend themselves to becoming beach accessories as well as hers would. Most of the other skins have a fairly good theme or are very well made so I can absolutely agree with those, but Draven just feels out of place in this lineup of strong themes. 

The Draven skin really just feels like cheesecake for the sake of cheesecake. Which is fine, got no problems with cheesecake in video games. It just goes against what you're claiming here, that's my only problem with it. Like if you guys just didn't want sexy ladies this year, cool, say that then.

>However I wanted to point out that this year there were much stronger visual and thematic hooks for other champions that the team were more excited about.

So...Draven is fine, but Ahri isn't because of contradicting reasoning.  Alright then, just checking. 

For the record, the Draven skin looks fantastic, and I'm sure people will love it...but uhh, yeah.  Just thought I should point  this odd rationale out to you if you weren't already aware of it.

I don't think this is a fair argument against female pool party skins. There's tons of potential with champs like Ahri, who as other people mentioned, has a very distinct silhouette and there's tons of fun ideas (beach ball orb or just a ball of water, synchronized swimmer with her ult, etc). Not to mention there's other female champs with lots of potential. Jinx (another rather distinct silhouette) with some comically complicated water guns, Fiora with pool noodles, just for a couple more examples (there are others that other people have already pointed out, such as Orianna).

The same argument could be made for male characters. Pool Party Zac (who is 'naked' in the first place), for example, is at it's core a blue Zac with a diving mask and shorts. Of course there's other fun stuff with done the skin, but that's the point of the pool party skins isn't it? Having fun with the champ and getting creative. If you're afraid to do something with a female champ because of some "anime effect," then you need to design better female champions (which are all very cool, do not get me wrong), or get someone who will be creative with your female champions.

P.S.: Pool Party Leona would like a word with you

So what's the difference with Ahri in a swimsuit and Draven in a speedo?!

Oho! Draven has inflatable spinning axes! Well 'Oho! Ahri could have an inflatable beach ball!' The hypocrisy is real.

This is complete garbage.There is easily a strong theme you could make for Ahri,like someone suggested below,as a syncronized swimmer.Her orb and foxfire could become watery,and I'm sure there's some graceful animation changes you could make when she uses them.And her ultimate could have her swimming in the air when she dashes/fires off a charge.Saying it's "just Ahri in a bikini" is no excuse,even if this idea would have more of a competition swimsuit in mind.

Do you know who has a great silhouette/body type {{champion:61}}, the beach ball theme would be fun, just about the same as giving Lee Sin a coconut or Graves a super soaker.

She would have good potential in the Q or moving anition being the ball bouncing, the R being a large water swell bring everyone to the middle, i can even see the W rolling with the champion as they walk over like, like the giant inflatables that people use to go over water. She could make a reference to not wanting to go into the water with her recall, or another cute dance :D

the body type part is true but as far as silhuette are concerned there's a lot going on their animation and stance/poses (syndra, riven and orianna all move very differently), their weapons, etc.
